alert.note: Alert for Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:31PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washington Parish, north central Hancock and Pearl River Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 230 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Poplarville, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bogalusa, Poplarville, Varnado, Crossroads and Mcneil. This includes Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 13 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
